column4: helo my ubuntu has some problems latly i had an update and it needed 157mb and in my disk there is 215 gb and the error mesage told me to do sudo apt-get clean now whenever i go to the applications button. nothing apears but it gets highlighted
use pastebin to post the output of df -h
http://pastebin.ca/1567011
you used wubi to install?
yes
ok, no way of resizing without reinstalling, you'll need to start looking at whats installed and removing some things
there is no other way but using wubi to reinstall
you can do a real install install of the quasi install that wubi is
what?
wubi "installs" ubuntu into a file inside windows, if windows goes boom, so does ubuntu
no, just saying *IF* windows goes boom then so does Ubuntu
so... how do i fix my problem
I told you, you need to clear space out or reinstall with a true install instead of using wubi
so i remove windows COMPLETLY but what happens if the real install doesnt work
how do i exit from ubuntu live cd
you don't need to remove windows completely, you can dual boot
shut down and reboot
thats how it gets hard
so no need for reinsyall
no but you need to free some room
IF a defect is found while on live cd what will i do
what do you mean?
